page.title: 03WINTER ON OTMOOR
page.content: When we walked along Otmoor Lane it was very muddy.The trees were bare of their leaves.Just one or two were hanging on in the cold wind.It was clear that animals live there because the frozen prints of birds and cattle were to be seen in the heavy,thick,grey mud.There were also the tracks made by horses hooves as their owners exercised them. The puddles were frozen over with sheets of ice.The moor was alive with ducks and swans feeding on the river or on the wet areas in the fields nearby.The swans moved like huge,white ghosts and the ducks poked their necks under the water.You could see some willow trees on the banks of the ditches in the distance.Somewhere across the flat moor there was the sound of a hunting horn and the hounds yelping as they led the hunt.
